avalancheActivity.comment: Winter sports enthusiasts can often trigger small-to-medium avalanches in the old snow. Danger zones occur mostly on very steep NW/N/NE-facing slopes and are difficult to recognize. Backcountry skiing tours demand a very conscious route selection. In high-altitude ridgeline terrain, fresh snowdrifts require caution. During the course of the day, esp. on steep sun-basked slopes, small wet-snow avalanches are possible. Small, in zones with heavy snowfall also medium-sized glide-snow avalanches are still possible and difficult to estimate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution on very steep shady slopes in high-alpine zones.

snowpackStructure.comment: On very steep shady slopes at high altitudes, there are still unfavorable intermediate layers in places. In wind-protected zones, the uppermost layers are still soft. The snowpack is thoroughly wet up to high altitudes and following good nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is usually capable of bearing loads and is stable. During daytime hours, especially on sunny slopes, the snowpack forfeits its firmness.

tendency.highlights: Danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede only slowly. On Friday, much warmer, zero-degree level at 3000m. Danger of wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches will increase.

weatherForecast.comment: Quite pleasant. Cirrus clouds passing through, intermittent sunshine. During the daytime, esp. in the Northern Alps, some convective cloud build-up which will spread. At 2000m: +2 degrees. Moderate to brisk northerly winds at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Isolated triggerings are possible by large additional loading on extremely steep slopes. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. Small, fresh snowdrifts require caution in high altitude ridgeline terrain. During daytime hours, avalanche danger levels increase slightly, esp. on sun-basked steep slopes, small, wet avalanches are possible. Small, in zones where snowfall has been heavier isolated medium-sized avalanches are still possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Predominantly favorable conditions. Beware slight daytime rise in danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack is thoroughly wet up to high altitudes and following good nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is usually capable of bearing loads and is stable. During daytime hours, especially on sunny slopes, the snowpack forfeits its firmness. In high-alpine zones, small snowdrift accumulations are evident. At lower altitudes there is little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: On Friday, much warmer, zero-degree level at 3000m. Danger of wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches will increase.

weatherForecast.comment: Quite pleasant. Cirrus clouds passing through, intermittent sunshine. During the daytime, esp. in the Northern Alps, some convective cloud build-up which will spread. At 2000m: +2 degrees. Moderate to brisk northerly winds at high altitudes.

customData.generalHeadline: Caution in high-alpine zones. Beware slight daytime rise in danger.
